intro: Masdevallia meiracyllium, commonly known as the Meiracyllium masdevallia, is a rare and striking orchid native to the high-altitude cloud forests of South America. It is characterized by its intricate, often colorful flowers that feature a unique combination of sepals and petals. The plant typically grows as a miniature orchid, with compact growth and a preference for cool, humid environments. Its foliage consists of broad, leathery leaves that are arranged in a rosette pattern. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a challenging species for cultivation.
